Lao smoothly BEHEADS the snake with the Blade aga the stone surface of the desk and discards the writhing b He squeezes behind one of the eyes and a VENOM SAC protru like a dark pimento. dialogues.text: Eric lower, Skull Cowboy superior, the storm wild around

dialogues.text: Eric Talking to dead air.  Almost arguing with it.  Eerie

A shard of the Skull Cowboy blows past Eric and transmutes to dust!

dialogues.text: Of course you can. ANGLE - GRANGE IN THE GALLERY --  in darkness.  The runni lights on his night-scoped, laser-sighted sniper's rifle THROWS vague sprays of eerie red and green light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't permit your rage to cloud the issue.  I believe in barter. I propose a simple trade. Grange sights his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC AT THE ALTER
dialogues.text: Bluring as Grange resights.  Eric is not the target.  Blu FINDS the crow at the far end of the nave, perched in fro a giant stained glass window. NEW ANGLE - GRANGE -- squeezing off two quick, SILENCED s ANGLE - STAINED GLASS WINDOW -- the first shot blows a ho some pastoral religious presentation.  TINKLE of glass. ANGLE - ERIC -- Spinning at the quiet !pfut! sound, to wi

dialogues.speaker: INCOMING DART
dialogues.text: SPinning and hissing venomously.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC DUCKS
dialogues.text: As before, but the crow is not as fast.

dialogues.speaker: THE CROW
dialogues.text: As it catches the dart and goes down in a flurry of feath

dialogues.speaker: ERIC AT ALTER
dialogues.text: His knees buckle.  Sympathetic PAIN from the hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You intended to finish this evening in the cemetery.  I am  here to help you on your way.

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING GRANGE IN GALLERY
dialogues.text: Swapping his tranquilizer gun for a more lethal rifle, si scoped.  He sights the fallen Eric in a spray of green li

dialogues.speaker: HAND HELD
dialogues.text: Groping for support to drag himself back to standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got him if you want him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move in, guys. HIGH ANGLE - THE SANCTUARY -- as Lao Guards #3 and #4 mov into light, closing on Eric's position in the center of i Both wield calico's and one bears a sword. CLOSE ANGLE - ALTER -- Lao makes his entrance from shadow wearing a brisk pugilist get-up, a practical fighting out Makes a show of drawing the killing blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish to possess what you have now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the girl.  Unharmed.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  That is why I will prevail.  Mr. Grange... ? Eric CRAMPS UP, CLUTCHING his throat in obvious pain.

dialogues.speaker: GRANGE AT STAINED GLASS WINDOW
dialogues.text: Holding the crow by the neck, TIGHTLY.  He plucks the tra from the its body.

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING ERIC AS LAO MOVES IN CLOSER
dialogues.text: Crashing to one knee, invisibly bludgeoned, struggling to breathe.  Lao has no fear, walking around the stricken Er

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner or later, my action were destined to bring me a genuine Fury.  And it turned out to be you. At last.  I appreciate your abilities as few mortals can. That's why I desire them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too late.  There was a guy outside - on the stairs - you really need to talk to.  But he  turned to dust and blew away. (beat, gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any power for you to take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe that. Lao motions to Grange with the killing blade.  Grange REL his deathgrip on the crow.  MOVE IN CLOSE on Eric so we m perceive a palpable degree of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for you to die for me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, how the dead can still bleed.  How they need air. Eric IMMOBILIZED as Lao DRAWS BACK the Blade.  To Grange:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break its neck. ANGLE - RESUMING GRANGE AT WINDOW as he prepares to do di the bird. Over his shoulder, we PUSH in to the BULLETHOLE from the dart until we're in TIGHT CLOSE-UP of an eye watching thr the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albrecht digs through a sling bag of weaponry, trying to simultaneously monitor the peephole, muttering sotto to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to go get yourself hip-deep in shit, didn't you, my friend. It begins to rain.  Albrecht glances resentfully toward t sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it a rest, huh? A hefts a machinegun, clipped over and under.  CUTS LOOSE full auto into the Madonna on the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the window EXPLODES toward Grange and he sucks big hit behind, DROPPING the crow.  The bird hits the ground, fla weakly. LAO GUARDS #3 & #4 exchange a look and whip up their RETURNING FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albrecht takes cover as a lot of religious stuff is noisi destroyed all around his position.  Chunks of the window continue to disintegrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric tuck-and-rolls out of the way as we go CLOSE on Lao, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said no shooting! Then he's ducking bullets himself as Albrecht STEPS IN th the blown out window, the machine gun stuttering on slugs The sanctuary comes apart around Lao.  He RETREATS to the and EXITS whence he came. TIGHT ON PEW -- ERIC DIVES just as Guard #4 comes after h the sword, which chomps into the wood and gets stuck ther Guard #4 releases it and cross draws his Calico as ERIC s back into the frame -- STRAIGHT UP. TIGHT ON GUARD #4 as Eric's lancing foot propels him back before he can fire. INTERCUTS -- ALBRECHT AND GUARD #3 scrambling to reload. changes magazine; Albrecht swaps clips. ANGLE - DOWN LENGTH OF PEW -- Guard #4 slides.  Sits up w gun as Eric, down-pew, grabs the sword. ANGLE - ALBRECHT AT WINDOW  firing now with a gun in each RESUME ERIC AND GUARD #4, who eats it from Albrecht's gun but not before he puts a round through Eric. Eric staggers back from the impact but keeps his feet.   RESUME ALBRECHT as he tosses away the dry pistol.  His ma gun jams, he fights to get the clip. ANGLE - GUARD #3 -- reloaded and rising, having caught Al dead-bang in the open by the window. MOVING ANGLE - WITH ERIC --  A complex leap with the swor flashing.  He lands near Guard #3 and SLASHES UPWARDS, bl CLOSE-UP - GUARD #3 -- screaming in pain, gaping DOWN O.S TIGHT ON ALBRECHT - looking UP, following the trajectory something AIRBORNE toward him. CLOSE-UP - GUARD #3'S Calico spinning mid-air with Guard HANDS still attached, severed mid-forearm by Eric's devas strike. ANGLE - ALBRECHT drops Guard #3 -- to REVEAL Eric in the background.  Eric salutes Albrecht with the tip of the sw WITH ALBRECHT as he moves into the nave, which has been t apart by gunfire.  Hazy smoke.  Two dead guys.  And Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sorta looked like you might need my help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't your place.  This isn't your fight.  And I don't need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave here.  Don't do this.  I don't want you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you say.  This isn't just  about you any more. Eric stares dead-on at Albrecht, acidly, then BREAKS the sword, dropping the pieces and turning his back on Albrec pursues Eric to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crow FLAPS UPWARD through the void.  Eric grabs the t bellrope, testing it.  A final look to Albrecht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't interfere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bleeding, man.  You can't make it. Eric shinnies up the bellrope, ignoring Albrecht.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALBRECHT
dialogues.text: Watching as Eric dissappears from view, fast..  Grumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't mind if I just take the stairs, then, smartass... He hefts his arsenal bag of hardware and begins to plod u steps. ANGLE - MOVING WITH ERIC ON THE ROPE -- A weird perspecti speed climb.  Zip!  All the way to the top.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Slanted, shingled, slippery, dark.  Lightning deep in the clouds.  The crow circles as Eric RISES INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am. DOWNFRAME lightning STRIKES the ornate LIGHTNING ROD (lar Victorian, lance-like) at the far end of the roof from th tower. SILHOUETTING Lao and Elly standing in front of it.  Elly flinches at the strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fly, Crow man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops his ascent to light a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't cut out for this superhero shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao SNAPS Elly's free handcuff to the dimly glowing  ligh rod and advances, one foot on either side of the peak of roof, his blade brandished. CLOSE MOVING SHOT - ERIC -- Hands up to grapple, but weaponless.  He spiders to meet Lao, suddenly PICKING UP and RUNNING along the precarious peak. Lao sees him coming, braces to strike, but Eric executes FLYING LEAP right over Lao's head. ERIC LANDS, SLIPS, sprawls sideways, clinging to the peak roof.  Lao hurries in to slash with the blade, as Eric av The steel RINGS.  Eric converts his dodge into a low spin that DUMPS Lao. Eric SPREAD-EAGLES to keep from falling.  Distantly, Lao similarly saves himself. NEW ANGLE -- THE FIGHT -- Here comes Lao, crabbing back t the peak.  Eric ROLLS to Elly's position, GRABS the light rod and tries to wrest it loose. SIZZLE OF FLESH as Eric's hands are scorched: the metal i blue-hot. MOVING WITH LAO as Eric battles to free the lightning rod closes up distance, gives a warcry and prepares to swing Eric WRENCHES the rod loose and turns to deflect Lao's bl The weapons spark as they meet... and there goes Elly, he handcuff freed, SLIDING DOWN THE ROOF SLOPE. ANGLE  -- ROOF SLOPE -- WITH ERIC  as he dodges Lao by us lightning rod to vault down to where Elly is about to sli the roof. With the rod embedded in the roof, Eric hangs on, and ell on to Eric. UP ANGLE -- LAO, a dark figure against the night sky, rai the sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face me! Eric guides Elly to the top of one of the flying buttress When he looks up, Lao is gone. ANGLE - BELL TOWER -- Albrecht's head pokes up at last. around, finally spots Eric below and to the left.  YELLS,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead yet? INSERT - ALBRECHT'S HOLSTER as Lao's hand draws Albrecht' gun quickly. ANGLE - ALBRECHT AND LAO --Lao has blindsided Albrecht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You are. He jams the gun into the base of ALbrecht's neck and fire CLOSE ANGLE - ERIC - He's too far away to matter.  Shock. INSERT - ALBRECHT'S CIGARETTE as it rolls down the slope, trailing sparks, snuffing out. ANGLE - ERIC holding onto the lightning rod as lightning night above him. ANGLE -- LAO AT BELL TOWER, triumphant and a bit wild, SH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've caused another death, Mister Draven!  The girl will die as well -- because of you!

dialogues.speaker: ELLY ON FLYING BUTTRESS
dialogues.text: The base of a triangle - Lao, Eric, Elly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to hell, you pervert!

dialogues.speaker: RESUME ERIC
dialogues.text: Rage over the loss of Albrecht.  He RISES, hurting but ma hell.  GLARES UP toward Lao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how many lives have you destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took yours from you.  Your little girlfriend?  I took hers, too.  Your meaningless, petty life?  I took it so that tonight your existence might gain a purpose.  You're no avenger. You're mine. PUSH IN TIGHT ON ERIC. Eyes alight with hatred for Lao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, I'm not an avenger.  Not any more. As lightning strikes, Eric Fires his gaze TOWARD THE SKY.

dialogues.speaker: LAO ON ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: SEEING the crash dive toward Lao through the row's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LAO ON ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: As the crow wings down INTO FRAME and lights on Lao's hea CLOSE-UP -- THE CROW ON LAO'S HEAD slashing with its claw Pecking out Lao's eyes. WITH ERIC -- on the roofslope as he totters but maintains climb, the crow/Lao UPFRAME B.G. RESUME LAO -- as the crow abandons him.  Lao STAGGERS AND down the roof - toward Eric. SLANTED ANGLE -- ERIC AND LAO -- Eric ARRESTS Lao's fall, fisting lapels and bringing him nose to nose.  Fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for a sacrifice. Lao's face is a hideous bloody mask with black holes wher eyes used to be.  He smiles gruesomely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need eyes to take what I want from you. He EMBRACES Eric and RAMS the killing blade deep into Eri back! ON ERIC as he looks down to see the blade protruding from sternum.  Tight grimace.  A lot of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fly? He pulls Lao into a BACKWARD ROLL down the roof, HOLDING TIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric lands on his back, forcing the blade THROUGH himself INTO Lao.  Eric completes the roll and KICKS Lao off INTO the killing blade still embedded in him! WITH LAO as crashes, sliding, sprawling down PAST Elly's position.  Gets to his knees atop the flying buttress.  S blade in his own chest. CLOSE-UP - ELLY - she sees it all happen. RESUME LAO - a regretful look toward Eric.  He PLUMMETS o roof edge. ANGLE - ERIC SLIDES DOWN ROOF --  He slows, stopping when is in frame.  He clutches his own chest.  Regards his own shaking hand, drenched in his won blood.  Glazed. ON ELLY, as she finally gets the duct tape off her mouth, to get to Eric.  She flails and cries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me fall! CLOSE-UP -- their hands finally meet and GRASP TIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low angle TRACKING SHOT (as when we first met Elly). Eric's and Elly's feet pass graves.  Eric's pace is slow, limping.  They STOP at a grave where elly BENDS INTO FRAM the flowers there. Eric is bloody and out of it.  She helps him walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now do you get to see her? Shelly, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a better place.  I hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna come back, are you? Eric's response is halting and uncertain.  But he tries t her hope.  He reaches for Shelly's ring around her neck, it up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can.  But you have this... and you know where to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you'll, like' dig your way out of the grave?  Euww. Eric is amused by this in spite of his grievous injuries. He grasps Elly's face in his hands and bends, painfully,t her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, I'll try.  Promise.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE WITH ERIC
dialogues.text: Spent, empty, he holds the rose determinedly, but he's ne going to make it the few yards back to his own grave.  So His legs finally go and he collapses onto the humus.  One groping hand tries to drag him further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me now.

dialogues.speaker: ELLY
dialogues.text: Tears on her face.  She can't watch this.  She TURNS and the flowers on Shelly's grave.

dialogues.speaker: HIS OWN GRAVE
dialogues.text: Still too far away to matter.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME ERIC ON GROUND
dialogues.text: He gives it up, his face sinking into the wet grass for a before SHELLY'S HAND intrudes INTO FRAME to GRASP his han No ethereal glow, no heavenly choir... just a near-dead E blank-faced astonishment, and he moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: ELLY
dialogues.text: She struggles to get her hood up against the rain and rou wipes the moisture from her face with her sleeve.  She tu toward Eric's grave.  Then, surprised, she looks close.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC'S GRAVE
dialogues.text: Eric is gone.  The white rose lies neatly on the top of t undisturbed  earth there.

dialogues.speaker: CEMETERY
dialogues.text: Emphasizing that Elly is now ALONE in the graveyard. LOW ANGLE on Elly, ROSE in the foreground -- She walks OFF.  HOLD the rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grey day but no rain.  Elly stands wistfully by the win her doll on standby.  The apartment is in order and perha notice a few new items.  Gabriel the cat, miraculously AL sprawled on a chair, licking himself.  Darla BUSTLES INTO B.G.  Her wardrobe more upscale, her hair done.  Her mann hectic but natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worktime, kiddo.  First day, new job, gotta go. This does not get the expected smile from Elly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you're gonna be okay? Elly turns from the window and NODS silently.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The aforementioned grey day in the city. ANGLE - DARLA AND ELLY AT THE WINDOW. Darla comes up.  Arm around Elly.  Cheer up; he attitude more connected and loving.  PUSH IN ON ELLY so we know sh clutching SHelly's ring tightly in her hand.  Darla looks Elly, out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least it finally stopped raining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't rain all the time. Darla kisses Elly on the temple and it out the door.  Ell her hand to consider the ring.  She looks back out the wi

dialogues.speaker: THE CROW ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: Elly is looking right at it.  Same crow.  We're positive. Elly.  It TAKES WING and flies away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An UP ANGLE from Eric's grave toward the tree as the crow INTO FRAME and perches there, shucking water.  PUSH IN on crow.  Watching.  Waiting.
